data.comment: The first-half is just kicking off.
Throw-in for Ipswich at Portman Road Stadium.
In the minute 4, Throw-in for Wigan in their own half.
Can Wigan get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Ipswich's half?
Ipswich awarded a free kick in their own half.
In the minute 5, Free kick for Ipswich in their own half.
A throw-in for the home team on the opposite half.
Wigan needs to be cautious. Ipswich have an attacking throw-in.
In the minute 6, Ipswich drive forward but Alan Judge is judged offside.
Wigan's Gary Roberts misses with an attempt on goal.
It's a goal kick for the home team in Ipswich.
In the minute 8, Throw-in Wigan.
Ipswich to take a throw-in in Wigan territory.
Throw-in for Ipswich in the half of Wigan.
In the minute 11, Throw-in for Ipswich in the half of Wigan.
Goal! Teddy Bishop heads Ipswich into a 1-0 lead.
Wigan have a dangerous throw-in.
In the minute 14, Corner awarded to Wigan.
Wigan takes a corner from the right.
Emeka Obi of Wigan gets in a strike, but is off target.
In the minute 15, Goal kick for Ipswich at Portman Road Stadium.
Wigan takes a corner from the left.
Ball safe as Ipswich is awarded a throw-in in their half.
In the minute 17, Ball goes out of play for a Ipswich goal kick.
Free kick for Wigan in their own half.
Free kick for Ipswich in the half of Wigan.
In the minute 20, Wigan awarded a throw-in in their own half.
Ipswich to take a throw-in in Wigan territory.
Throw-in for Ipswich close to the penalty box.
In the minute 21, Ipswich are coming forward and Andre Dozzell gets in a strike, it misses the target, however.
Wigan have a goal kick.
Aaron Drinan for Ipswich is whistled offside.
In the minute 24, Throw-in high up the field for Ipswich in Ipswich.
Corner awarded to Ipswich.
Aaron Drinan (Ipswich) wins the ball in the air but heads wide.
In the minute 25, Goal kick for Wigan at Portman Road Stadium.
In Ipswich a free kick has been awarded the away team.
Can Wigan get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Ipswich's half?
In the minute 26, A throw-in for the home team on the opposite half.
Ipswich's Luke Chambers is on target but unsuccessful.
Throw-in for Ipswich in the half of Wigan.
In the minute 28, Teddy Bishop (Ipswich) gets in a great strike â€“ straight into the post! Ohhhh so close!
Wigan awarded a throw-in in their own half.
Free kick Ipswich.
In the minute 30, Wigan are pushing forward but Gary Roberts's finish is wide of the goal.
Ball goes out of play for a Ipswich goal kick.
Wigan awarded a free kick in their own half.
In the minute 32, Dan Gardner is writhing in pain and play has been suspended for a few moments.
Wigan's Dan Gardner is back in action after a slight knock.
Wigan's Joe Garner attacks the ball with his head but his effort fails to hit the target.
In the minute 34, Throw-in Ipswich.
Ball safe as Ipswich is awarded a throw-in in their half.
In Ipswich a free kick has been awarded the away team.
In the minute 36, Lee Evans (Wigan) gets in a strike but the shot is blocked by a defender.
It's a goal kick for the home team in Ipswich.
Wigan have a goal kick.
In the minute 39, Viv Solomon-Otabor (Wigan) goes for goal but the shot is blocked by an alert defence.
Ipswich pushes forward through Freddie Sears, whose finish on goal is saved.
Corner awarded to Ipswich.
In the minute 42, Can Ipswich capitalize from this throw-in deep inside Wigan's half?
Free kick Wigan.
Throw-in for Wigan at Portman Road Stadium.
In the minute 44, Throw-in for Ipswich in their own half.
A throw-in for the home team on the opposite half.
It's getting dangerous! Free kick for Ipswich close to the penalty box.
In the minute 45, Can Ipswich capitalize from this dangerous free kick?
2 minutes of injury time will be added to the 1st half.
Freddie Sears of Ipswich gets in a strike, but is off target.
In the minute 45, It's a goal kick for the away team in Ipswich.
Wigan to take a throw-in in Ipswich territory.
Throw-in Wigan.
In the minute 45, The first-half is over.
The whistle has gone to start the second-half.
Free kick for Ipswich in their own half.
Ipswich's Alan Judge misses with an attempt on goal.
James Norwood is replacing Aaron Drinan for the home team.
In the minute 46, Alex Perry is on a sub for Dan Gardner for Wigan.
In the minute 47, Ipswich awarded a free kick in their own half.
Ball safe as Wigan is awarded a throw-in in their half.
Can Ipswich get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Wigan's half?
In the minute 49, Ipswich takes a corner from the left.
Wigan awarded a throw-in in their own half.
Free kick for Wigan in the half of Ipswich.
In the minute 52, Throw-in for Wigan close to the penalty box.
Throw-in for Ipswich at Portman Road Stadium.
Can Ipswich get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Wigan's half?
In the minute 55, James Norwood of Ipswich is pulled up for offside.
Alex Perry (Wigan) is given an opening but the shot is blocked by a defender.
Ipswich drive upfield and Alan Judge gets in a shot. The strike is blocked by a Wigan defender.
In the minute 56, Corner awarded to Ipswich.
Ball goes out of play for a Wigan goal kick.
Ipswich are coming forward and Freddie Sears gets in a strike, it misses the target, however.
In the minute 59, Wigan have a goal kick.
Throw-in for Wigan in the half of Ipswich.
Throw-in for Wigan in their own half.
In the minute 61, Wigan awarded a free kick in their own half.
Throw-in for Ipswich at Portman Road Stadium.
Luke Chambers (Ipswich) has received a first yellow card.
In the minute 62, A throw-in for the away team on the opposite half.
Ball safe as Ipswich is awarded a throw-in in their half.
Wigan to take a throw-in in Ipswich territory.
In the minute 63, Goal kick for Ipswich at Portman Road Stadium.
Free kick Wigan.
Wigan are pushing forward but Alex Perry's finish is wide of the goal.
In the minute 65, Ipswich have a goal kick.
Wigan awarded a throw-in in their own half.
Throw-in Wigan.
In the minute 67, Free kick for Wigan in their own half.
Ipswich's Freddie Sears has run offside.
Wigan to take a throw-in in Ipswich territory.
In the minute 72, Lee Evans of Wigan gets in a strike, but is off target.
Goal kick for Ipswich at Portman Road Stadium.
The home team replace Freddie Sears with Gwion Edwards.
In the minute 74, Throw-in for Wigan in their own half.
In Ipswich a free kick has been awarded the home team.
Teddy Bishop of Ipswich smashes in a shot on target. The keeper saves, though.
In the minute 75, Can Wigan get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Ipswich's half?
Throw-in for Ipswich in their own half.
Throw-in for Ipswich at Portman Road Stadium.
In the minute 76, Play has been temporarily suspended for attention to Viv Solomon-Otabor for Wigan who is writhing in pain on the pitch.
Ipswich make their third substitution with Emyr Huws replacing Teddy Bishop.
Viv Solomon-Otabor is back on his feet again.
In the minute 77, Free kick for Ipswich in the half of Wigan.
Can Ipswich capitalize from this throw-in deep inside Wigan's half?
Gwion Edwards of Ipswich is pulled up for offside.
In the minute 80, Goal! Gwion Edwards extends Ipswich's lead to 2-0.
James Norwood instrumental with a fine assist.
Throw-in for Ipswich in the half of Wigan.
In the minute 82, Wigan make their second substitution with Oliver Crankshaw replacing Christopher Merrie.
Free kick for Wigan in their own half.
Ball goes out of play for a Wigan goal kick.
In the minute 84, Ipswich awarded a free kick in their own half.
Throw-in Wigan.
A throw-in for the away team on the opposite half.
In the minute 87, Throw-in for Wigan in the half of Ipswich.
Wigan to take a throw-in in Ipswich territory.
Can Ipswich get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Wigan's half?
In Ipswich a free kick has been awarded the away team.
Ipswich drives forward and Gwion Edwards gets in a shot. Without netting, however.
Alan Judge (Ipswich) gets in a strike but the shot is blocked by a defender.
Ipswich takes a corner from the right.
3 minutes will be added to the 2nd half.
Ball safe as Ipswich is awarded a throw-in in their half.
A throw-in for the away team on the opposite half.
Free kick for Ipswich in the half of Wigan.
The match is over. Final score 2-0.
Alex Perry (Wigan) has been booked and must now be careful not to get a second yellow card.
